Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 1.3 (XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: A natural variant of caerin 1.1. with K11 substituted by Q.Activity: Activity against B. cereus (MIC 50 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 25 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 1.5 ug/ml), P. multocida (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 100 ug/ml), and S. uberis (MIC 100 ug/ml). By similarity to Caerin 1.1, it contains two amphipathic helices separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility. This peptide could inhibit HIV infection (VanCompernolle et al., 2015).Updated 6/2015. 4/2019 CW; 12/2024 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Stone DJ, Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.1993, Australia
Literature Information.Title: Peptides from Australian frogs. The structures of the caerins from Litoria caerula.
